Context:
The PLC Technician Certificate program is an introductory course focusing on practical applications of PLCs, with 19 modules in a web-based downloadable file format. The learning materials include text, audio, 2D and 3D animations, computer-based testing, and PLCLogix 500 simulation software. The interactive PLCLogix 500 simulation software converts a computer into a virtual PLC and allows running, verifying, and debugging ladder logic programs based on Rockwell RSLogix 500 format. This program helps users become familiar with various features of Rockwell PLCs, such as timers, counters, sequencers, and math functions.

The typical completion time for the program is 32 weeks, but there are no set time limits. To enroll, students need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent or mature student status; previous PLC experience is helpful but not necessary. The minimum computer requirements include an Intel or AMD processor, 4GB RAM, 500 MB of available disk space, and a Windows 7/8/8.1/10/11 operating system with internet access and an email account.

Career options after completing this program include opportunities in the rapidly expanding field of industrial automation.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) Technician Program (Distance Education) T903 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
This program is called PLC Technician program and it prepares students to work in the field of industrial automation and control. The program covers installing and repairing industrial electronic equipment such as I/O networks, data highways, variable speed drives, and process control equipment. Students will write PLC programs for a wide range of automated control systems and find employment in the industrial engineering field where they are involved in the design and implementation of PLC control systems.

The program consists of the following compulsory courses:
- ELNC 9071: Overview of PLCs
- ELNC 9072: Central Processing Unit
- ELNC 9073: I/O System
- ELNC 9074: Programming Terminals and Peripherals
- ELNC 9075: Installation and Maintenance of PLCs
- ELNC 9076: Relay Logic
- ELNC 9077: Ladder Logic
- ELNC 9078: Timers
- ELNC 9079: Counters
- ELNC 9080: MCR, JUMP and FORCE Instructions
- ELNC 9081: Sequencers
- ELNC 9082: Data Transfer
- ELNC 9083: Math Functions
- ELNC 9084: Process Control
- ELNC 9085: Data Communications
- ELNC 9086: Number Systems and Codes
- ELNC 9087: Digital Logic
- ELNC 9120: RTUs and PACs
- ELNC 9116: Introduction to Automation

The tuition for domestic students is $1,700.00 * and there is an additional cost of $440 for international students for initial registration which includes all learning materials, laboratory simulation software, and access to the Module 1 exam. Registration for each of the remaining 18 modules costs $70 per module.

* The text does not provide information about the number of years the program takes or contact information for the college.
